member.name: T:Twitterizer.OptionalProperties
member.summary: Provides a base class for method specific optional parameters, as well as properties for providing configuration settings at run time.

member.name: M:Twitterizer.OptionalProperties.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Twitterizer.OptionalProperties.ReadConfigurationSettings
member.summary: Reads the configuration settings.

member.name: P:Twitterizer.OptionalProperties.UseSSL
member.summary: Allows modification of the API endpoint addresses to enable SSL communication.
member.remarks:
The default value can be set at an application level by adding a Twitterizer2.EnableSSL application setting with the value true. For example:
<configuration> <appSettings> <!-- Enable use of SSL to reach Twitter --> <add key="Twitterizer2.EnableSSL" value="true" /> </appSettings> <configuration>
member.value: The current configured value. true if enabled, otherwise false. Default: false
member.summary: Allows configuration of the base address for API method requests for support for 3rd party 'twitter-like' APIs.

member.name: P:Twitterizer.OptionalProperties.APIBaseAddress
member.remarks:
The default value can be set at an application level by adding a Twitterizer2.APIBaseAddress application setting with the base address as the value. For example:
<configuration> <appSettings> <!-- Set or change this value to interface with a non-twitter API (like Wordpress) --> <add key="Twitterizer2.APIBaseAddress" value="http://api.twitter.com/1/" /> </appSettings> <configuration>
member.value: The API end point base address. Default: "http://api.twitter.com/1/"

member.name: P:Twitterizer.OptionalProperties.Proxy
member.summary: Allows overriding of the default proxy settings for API call requests.

member.name: P:Twitterizer.OptionalProperties.CacheOutput
member.summary: Allows run time enabling of API output caching.
member.remarks:
The default value can be set at an application level by adding a Twitterizer2.EnableCaching application setting with value true. For example:
<configuration> <appSettings> <!-- Enable caching results --> <add key="Twitterizer2.EnableCaching" value="true" /> </appSettings> <configuration>
member.value: The currently configured value. true if enabled, otherwise false. Default: false

member.name: P:Twitterizer.OptionalProperties.CacheTimespan
member.summary: Allows configuration of the sliding expiration timespan for output caching.
member.remarks:
The default value can be set at an application level by adding a Twitterizer2.CacheTimeout application setting with value equal to the number of seconds of the duration. For example:
<configuration> <appSettings> <!-- Sets the number of seconds to cache results (default is 5 minutes) --> <add key="Twitterizer2.CacheTimeout" value="300"/> </appSettings> <configuration>
member.value: The duration that API output should be cached, on a sliding expiration, once enabled. Default: 5 minutes

member.name: T:Twitterizer.TwitterPlaceLookupOptions
member.summary: Provides a payload for optional parameters for the method.

member.name: P:Twitterizer.TwitterPlaceLookupOptions.Accuracy
member.summary: A hint on the "region" in which to search. If a number, then this is a radius in meters, but it can also take a string that is suffixed with ft to specify feet. If this is not passed in, then it is assumed to be 0m. If coming from a device, in practice, this value is whatever accuracy the device has measuring its location (whether it be coming from a GPS, WiFi triangulation, etc.).

member.name: P:Twitterizer.TwitterPlaceLookupOptions.Granularity
member.summary: The minimal granularity of data to return. If this is not passed in, then neighborhood is assumed. city can also be passed.

member.name: P:Twitterizer.TwitterPlaceLookupOptions.MaxResults
member.summary: A hint as to the number of results to return. This does not guarantee that the number of results returned will equal max_results, but instead informs how many "nearby" results to return. Ideally, only pass in the number of places you intend to display to the user here.

To authenticate a user, there are 3 steps you will take:
